How can this be resolved?

choices.B: Enable encryption on the existing EFS volume by using the AWS Command Line Interface.
choices.C: Enable encryption on each host's local drive. Restart each host to encrypt the drive.
choices.D: Enable encryption on a newly created volume and copy all data from the original volume. Reconnect each host to the new volume.
choices.A: Enable encryption on each host's connection to the Amazon EFS volume. Each connection must be recreated for encryption to take effect.

questions.question_text:
An organization finds that a high number of gp2 Amazon EBS volumes are running out of space.
Which solution will provide the LEAST disruption with MINIMAL effort?

choices.D: Write a script to migrate data to a larger gp2 volume.
choices.B: Create a RAID 0 with another new gp2 volume to increase capacity.
choices.C: Leverage the Elastic Volumes feature of EBS to increase gp2 volume size.
choices.A: Create a snapshot and restore it to a larger gp2 volume.

discussion.content: C. Leverage the Elastic Volumes feature of EBS to increase gp2 volume size.

Selected Answer: C
The Elastic Volumes feature of Amazon EBS allows you to increase the size of an EBS volume on-the-fly without detaching it from the associated EC2 instance. This option minimizes disruption and effort, as it doesn't require creating snapshots, restoring volumes, setting up RAID configurations, or migrating data manually.

C is the answer

You can increase the volume size
